title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman    NEPOTISM

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

We would appreciate McLennan County and/or the Sheriff's Department policy on Nepotism. Husband, wife, husband, wife, child, are there any nepotism rules at the county? Is it in  handbook?

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman    List of Reserve Deputies

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman    List of Reserve Deputies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

We would like the status of DJ Adams as a reserve deputy, also we would appreciate an entire list of every person who is a Reserve Deputy and the date they became a Reserve Deputy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell
